title: Modern Marriage and How to Bear It
author: Maud Churton Braby
content_summary: A frank and witty discussion of the challenges of marriage in the early 20th century, exploring reasons for marital dissatisfaction and failure, societal changes affecting relationships, suggested alternatives (like leasehold marriage), the role of children, and practical advice for achieving happiness within marriage.
content_detailed: The book examines the growing dissatisfaction between sexes, reasons men and women avoid marriage (economic, social, personal), the plight of unmarried individuals, different types of marriages, common causes of conflict (money, sex, children, in-laws, communication), the optimal age to marry, infidelity ('Wild Oats for Wives'), the need for better education for girls, the 'crux' of fidelity, critiques of alternatives like free love and polygamy, discusses 'leasehold marriage' and 'duogamy', addresses the question of parenthood and family size, and concludes with suggestions for reform and practical advice for husbands and wives.
notes: Published 1908, clearly in the public domain in most regions including the US.
